channel.title: New laptop
channel.description: My girlfriend's grandparents have put me in charge of choosing a laptop for her as a grad. present. Any recommendations for a good/decent laptop with a reasonable price? They never said their budget, so just keep it under a grand CAD.

item.title: New laptop
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:13, topic:277920”][quote author=chrisn2323 link=topic=366856.msg2783081#msg2783081 date=1242270701]

no because MSI is a crappy company.

good laptops are dell, toshiba, asus, sony, lenovo

When I build computers, the only motherboards I will buy are MSI motherboards, they make top of the line motherboards, the best. They also make excellent video cards.

However I don’t know what kind of laptops they make, but since the mobos are so good I can’t see the laptops being bad.

I’ve heard iffy things about their mobos. Their manuals are also filled with engrish and their updating programs suck. My MSI video card is about to crap out on me too.

Engadget had an article that showed the inside of an msi laptop and they use masking tape to hold shit together…
[/quote]

Can you give me a link to that?

All of the computers I have built still have MSI motherboards and I’ve never had a problem with any of them.[/quote]
just read newegg reviews

Read full topic

item.title: New laptop
item.dc:creator: @Your_Master Your Master
item.description:
@Your_Master wrote:

Well it looks ok, but Asus is best, like Moparisthebest told you. I’ve had and Toshiba, but moved to Asus very good, i love my laptop:D

item.title: New laptop
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

xEnt:

MSI are alright, Asus are well quite cheap. I’ve had 2 Asus mobo’s and their sub company (AsRock) and they were all very cheap, and fucked up a lot. But then again i did buy them cheap so i don’t expect a DFI.

At least you didn’t get an abit motherboard. Now if mine fucks up I can’t do anything about it except get a new one.

Read full topic

item.title: New laptop
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:5, topic:277920”]Acer and HP are not bad brands. Check:http://www.emperorlinux.com/
You can find high-quality, kick ass parts there.[/quote]

I’ve had experience with 4 Acer laptops, 3 are still running but have between 1 to 10 minutes of battery power when unplugged from the wall, the other died once under warranty, was repaired by the factory, died twice after the warranty, the first time I was able to fix it (power plug on the mobo broke), and the second time it was beyond repair. They are OK, but I could not recommend them to people.

I have had minor experience with HP, srt8 had one before I met her, and since then we have taken it in for service 3 times, the last time they replaced the entire motherboard, and now that it is out of warranty it randomly locks up and needs shut down the hard way. (I think it is overheating, but the fan works and it’s all clean, don’t really know) It has been a good laptop for a few years though, so I wouldn’t recommend against them.

Still, go Asus and you won’t be sorry.

Read full topic

item.title: New laptop
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Acer and HP are not bad brands. Check:http://www.emperorlinux.com/
You can find high-quality, kick ass parts there.

item.title: New laptop
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

Not really looking for a netbook for her. I have an old laptop that is essentially a netbook and while it works great, I don’t think it’s right for her.

Read full topic

item.title: New laptop
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I’ve had/used a quite a few different brands of laptops, and far and away the best ones were made by Asus, so I would recommend you to get one.

I don’t know whether you are looking at netbooks or not, but the Asus 1000HA is great (8 hours of battery life, $350), Ashton loves hers.

Read full topic
